note.title: Computer Vision & Image Processing
note.content:
#### üìÑ Certificate & Notes
[View IBM Computer Vision Coursera Certificate](/pdf/Coursera V3VPXOHXT9JG.pdf)
[Access my Computer Vision & Image Processing Notes on Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/15tjKeP3mPkLtQgxz4qwLaMFX-AQeWNHF)

I studied Computer Vision because I was interested in how machines interpret images, and I also wanted to build a handwriting recognition project from scratch. This course gave me the foundational skills to understand modern image processing and deep learning‚Äìbased vision systems.

### üß† What I Learned
Through this course, I gained a full end-to-end understanding of how computer vision systems are built ‚Äî from raw image processing to deep learning‚Äìbased classification.

#### üì∑ Core Computer Vision Concepts
- How digital images work (pixels, color channels, grayscale, intensity mapping)
- Image preprocessing and transformation using **PIL** and **OpenCV**
- Feature extraction techniques such as **Histogram of Oriented Gradients (HOG)**
- Implementing traditional machine learning models for vision tasks: KNN, SVM, Logistic Regression, Neural Networks

#### ü§ñ Deep Learning & Advanced Techniques
- Building and training convolutional neural networks (CNNs)
- Data augmentation to improve model performance
- Transfer learning for faster training and higher accuracy
- Object detection methods including Haar cascades

#### üõ†Ô∏è Practical Applications Completed
- Handwritten digit recognition
- Simple object classification (cats vs. dogs)
- Metal structure detection
- Rust identification using image features
- Car detection using Haar cascade classifiers
